Nair''' is Donald A. Darling Professor of Statistics and a Professor of Industrial and Operations Engineering at the [[University of Michigan]]. He received his undergraduate degree in Economics from the University of Malaya, Malaysia and his PhD in Statistics from the University of California, Berkeley. His research interests include Engineering Statistics, Reliability, Design and Analysis of Experiments, and Quality Improvement. He was the chair of the Statistics department at University of Michigan during 1998–2003 and 2004–2010, and holds the record as the longest chair of a department in the college of Literature, Science and Arts. ==Professional Recognition== Vijay served as the President of the [[International Statistical Institute]] during 2013-2015. Prior to that, he served as the President of [[International Society for Business and Industrial Statistics]] during 2011-2013. He is Fellow of [[American Statistical Association]], [[Institute of Mathematical Statistics]], [[American Society for Quality]] and [[American Association for the Advancement of Science]]. He was chair of the Department of Statistics at [[University of Michigan]] during the years of 1998–2003 and 2004–2010. He is currently co-editor-in-chief of the International Statistical Review. He was the editor of [[Technometrics]] during 1990-1992.
